channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judge in Trump Documents Case Rejected Suggestions to Step Aside
item.description: Two federal judges in South Florida privately urged Aileen M. Cannon to decline the case when it was assigned to her last year, according to two people briefed on the matter. She chose to keep it.

item.title: Russia and North Korea’s Defense Pact Is a Told-You-So Moment in Asia
item.description: While the agreement rattled officials in South Korea and Japan, the two U.S. allies in recent years have been expecting growing security challenges from North Korea.

item.title: Elon Musk’s latest plan to add Venmo-like payments to X excludes crypto
item.description: New details have emerged of Musk's plans to launch X Payments, part of a bid to create "an everything app."

item.title: Russia and North Korea’s Defense Pact Is a Told-You-So Moment in Asia
item.description: While the agreement rattled officials in South Korea and Japan, the two U.S. allies in recent years have been expecting growing security challenges from North Korea.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Divisions Between Israel’s Military and Government Spill Into Open
item.description: The armed forces’ chief spokesman went public with frustration over Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s failure to advance a plan for governing postwar Gaza.

item.title: Beware, finance bros: AI is coming for banking before any other kinds of jobs, Citigroup warns
item.description: AI will “profoundly change money,” Citigroup says, and create plenty of “losers” along the way.

item.title: Donald Sutherland, ‘M*A*S*H’ and ‘Hunger Games’ Star, Dies at 88
item.description: In a wide-ranging career (from “M*A*S*H” to “Ordinary People” to “Invasion of the Body Snatchers”), he could be endearing in one role, menacing in another and just plain odd in a third.

item.title: Attack of Jewish Girl Spurs Tensions Over Antisemitism in France
item.description: The alleged rape of a 12-year-old Jewish girl is inflaming an already tense and divisive situation.

item.title: The ‘affordability crisis’ has long plagued renters—but now it’s coming for homeowners
item.description: Nearly one in four homeowners are now “stretched worryingly thin,” states a new Harvard University report.

item.title: Democrats’ Dream of a Wealth Tax Is Alive. For Now.
item.description: A narrow Supreme Court ruling left the door open for Congress to expand taxes on billionaires, but it’s not a guarantee.

item.title: Monkeys in Puerto Rico Got Nicer After Hurricane Maria
item.description: Macaques, reeling from a hurricane, learned by necessity to get along, a study found. It’s one of the first to suggest that animals can adapt to environmental upheaval with social changes.

item.title: I’ve been practicing medicine at a renowned institution for 40 years. Society isn’t ready for us to reverse the aging process across an entire population
item.description: Dr. Joel Geiderman is convinced there is a biological mechanism that triggers the onset of aging and with enough research, we will discover what it is. Sooner, rather than later.

item.title: Supreme Court Upholds Trump-Era Tax Provision
item.description: The dispute, which was closely watched by experts, involved a one-time foreign income tax, but many saw it as a broader challenge to pre-emptively block Congress from passing a wealth tax.

item.title: U.S. Will Redirect Deliveries of Patriot Missiles to Ukraine
item.description: A White House spokesman said Ukraine had a critical need for the air-defense systems. But the United States has only a limited supply.

item.title: Amazon got blasted by environmental groups for years over using reams of plastic. Now it’s switching to recycled paper packaging
item.description: The e-commerce giant said it already switched more than 95% of its packaging in North American to the new paper alternative.
